curated_text: Symbol: MDLZ. Year: 2024. Period: Q1. ReportType: Q10. Section: Competition and Market Position. This section discusses competitors, market dynamics, and regulatory landscape.  Competitors mentioned: the European Economic Area, the European Commission, the European Union, Third-Party Guarantees, Mondelēz International, Mondelēz International: Balance, KDP, EPS, AMEA, Basis of Presentation, Acquisitions and Divestitures, Plant and Equipment, Restructuring Program, Financial Instruments, AMEA Europe North America Total, Biscuits & Baked Snacks, Gum & Candy, Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition, Overview of Business and Strategy, Significant Items Affecting Comparability, Commodity Trends, Basis of Presentation - War, Items Affecting Comparability of Financial Results, Hamas, ERP System Implementation, Board of Directors, ERP, the ERP System Implementation, Organic Net Revenue, MD&A, • Organic Net Revenue, Developed Markets, Evirth (Shanghai) Industrial Co., Ltd, Halls, Perfetti Van Melle Group, JAB Holdings Company, Company, the Organization of Economic Cooperation and Development’s, Non-GAAP Financial Measures, Consolidated Results of Operations, Financial Measures, • Diluted EPS, ERP Systems Implementation, Adjusted EPS, the Consolidated Results of Operations, Basis of Presentation – War, SAP, Diluted, Chinese yuan, Grow Program, Incremental, Key Drivers, Adjusted Operating Income, MD&A Headlines, Mondelēz International, 1.7 Organic, European Commission, 47 Table of Contents Liquidity and, Capital Resources, Contingencies, 48 Table of Contents, DIV, Mondelez International Holdings Netherlands B.V.. Context excerpt: competition law through certain practices allegedly restricting cross-border trade within the European Economic Area. On January 28, 2021, the European Commission announced it had taken the next procedural step in its investigation and opened formal proceedings. As previously disclosed, we have cooperated with the investigation. In the fourth quarter of 2022, we had accrued (in accordance with U.S. GAAP), on a pre-tax basis, a liability of € 300 million ($ 321 million) within other current liabilities in the consolidated balance sheet and selling, general and administrative expenses in the consolidated statement of earnings as an estimate of the possible cost to resolve this matter. During the fourth quarter of 2023, we adjusted our accrual to a liability of € 340 million ($ 375 million). In the second quarter of 2024, we reached a negotiated resolution in this matter and adjusted our accrual from a liability of € 340 million to € 337.5 million ($ 376 million), on a pre-tax basis. Purs
